posts.post_content: The premier red creature common in scars draft. Synergizes well with [Panic Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panic Spellbomb), since you only need three artifacts when it enters the battlefield.

posts.post_content:
@U-caster  
All of the card text on Blade-Tribe Berserkers is a single triggered ability that goes off ONLY when it enters the battlefield. When it does, it checks for metalcraft. If you have metalcraft, it gets +3/+3 and haste until end of turn.
posts.html:
@U-caster
All of the card text on Blade-Tribe Berserkers is a single triggered ability that goes off ONLY when it enters the battlefield. When it does, it checks for metalcraft. If you have metalcraft, it gets +3/+3 and haste until end of turn.

Posted By: Vinifera7 (10/24/2010 11:27:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I had though the +3/+3 was permanent, but it's pretty clear it's a end-of-turn triggered effect.
  
   
I liked [Ezuri's Brigade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ezuri's Brigade) better when I thought the effects on both were permanent. Now it disappoints me again how much of a difference rarity makes (a little can be attributed to Red vs Green, but still...). Still, pretty good in limited.
  
   
Vs [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning), it sticks around afterwards and is better vs first strike, but is more expensive and lacks trample.
posts.html:
I had though the +3/+3 was permanent, but it's pretty clear it's a end-of-turn triggered effect.

I liked Ezuri's Brigade better when I thought the effects on both were permanent. Now it disappoints me again how much of a difference rarity makes (a little can be attributed to Red vs Green, but still...). Still, pretty good in limited.

Vs Ball Lightning, it sticks around afterwards and is better vs first strike, but is more expensive and lacks trample.

posts.post_content: This guy is nuts in limited. posts.post_content: Like this guy a lot. Swinging for a hasty 6 to the face on turn 4 is a great feeling. Either takes a huge chunk of life or steamrollers a defender. A definite grab for anyone drafting metalcraft.
